item.title: Land Surveyor
item.description:
Our client, an established and well-known company is looking for a Land Surveyor to join their team and work on projects in the Central belt of Scotland and across the UK. As a Land Surveyor, you will play an important role in building and further developing the surveying team including mentoring and managing junior members of staff.

We have met with and work closely with this company and can say with certainty that this is an excellent opportunity within the market at the moment.

To be considered for this role you will:
• Have extensive experience within land surveying
• Rail experience is desirable but not essential
• Utilities experience is desirable but not essential
• Be able to manage and mentor junior members of staff
• Ability to liaise with external stakeholders
• Have experience of using LSS, Trimble, AutoCAD
• Excellent verbal and written communication

What is on offer?
You will receive a competitive salary in line with your experience, paid overtime, pension and more!!

To apply for this position, please submit your CV to Savanna Mitchell. I will also discuss the company in full detail. Having this in depth conversation ensures that I can help you as best as I can in your next career move. Please note your CV will not be sent anywhere without your permission.

item.title: Senior Civils Technician - Development Infrastructure
item.description:
Contract Scotland are working in partnership with a multi-disciplinary engineering consultancy as they look for a Senior Civils Technician (Development Infrastructure) to join their team in Glasgow.

Due to an increased workload, this engineering consultancy is looking to appoint someone with proven experience to become an integral, valued member of their team. This role will see you working on a range of public, commercial and industrial developments.

Sitting within an established team you will be responsible for;
• Producing designs and technical specifications for roads, drainage (including SUDs), earthworks, landscaping and other associated civil works

item.title: Land Manager
item.description:
An expanding housebuilder is looking for a Land Manager/Land Buyer to join their existing team to oversee and actively pursue land and development opportunities within the East of Scotland.

This builder is one of the top 10 builders in the UK, so you'd be joining a business with a recognised brand and a growing reputation. They're passionate about creating developments which can help meet the country's huge demand for high quality new build homes and their strategy is to look to create homes for both sale and affordable rent.

This is an exciting opportunity for people from various backgrounds, such as town planning, valuation surveying and land management, to break into the realm of private housing and to bring a fresh outlook to a well-established team. Alternatively, you might have an existing track record in purchasing land for residential development but feel that now is the time to consider a change, particularly with a business who genuinely aim to approach things in a different way to the average housebuilder.

Within the role you will be reporting to the Land Director, proactively identifying and securing target sites in line with the company's regional business plan, working through the process from beginning to end. You'll need to make use of excellent communication and negotiation skills to build relationships and secure sites.

You'll not necessarily be pursuing the average' land deal, as this builder often seek out more challenging regeneration opportunities, such as brownfield sites, or those with existing buildings in situ.

In return for the perfect candidate, the business is willing to offer a salary which should more than match those in the market and provide a notable commission scheme to reward deals.

If you are interested in joining a growing housebuilder at a time of expansion and feel you fit the above profile, please contact me on 01786 446651.

item.title: Senior Civil/Structural Technician
item.description:
Experienced Civil/Structural Technician needed on a permanent basis in Glasgow. This is an excellent opportunity to join a widely respected consultancy who, in recent years have successfully consolidated its place within the public and private sector building markets.

As a Civil/Structural Technician, you will be involved in a diverse range of projects including commercial, retail, residential and public buildings including schools and further education facilities.

Day to day duties will include:
• Preparing and maintaining fully detailed Structural and Civil Engineering drawings
• Producing and/or working on BIM models
• Producing detailing of roads and drainage
• Assisting other CAD Technicians and Engineers with project delivery

The following are required;
• HNC/HND Qualified in Civil Engineering (or equivalent)
• Demonstrable knowledge in current versions of AutoCAD and Revit as well as Civils 3D
• Experience in detailing steelwork, concrete, reinforcement scheduling, timber and masonry construction
• Experience in the detailing of roads and drainage
• Ability to assist Engineering teams with surveys and report preparation
• Ability to manage a busy workload with different and numerous deadlines
• Aptitude for learning and a desire to progress

What do you get in return?
The opportunity to join a company which offers long term career stability, a secure workload and career progression opportunities. As well as a competitive salary, pension, private health care, ride to work scheme, good annual leave allowance, support for professional development.

To apply for this position, please submit your CV to Savanna Mitchell. Once received and if suitable for this position, I will give you a call to discuss your experience, current situation as well as what it is your are looking for in a move going forward. I will also discuss the company in full detail. Having this in depth conversation ensures that I can help you as best as I can in your next career move.

item.title: Senior Civil Engineer - Development Infrastructure
item.description:
Contract Scotland are working in partnership with a multi-disciplinary engineering consultancy as they look for a Senior Engineer (Development Infrastructure) to join their team in Glasgow. This role offers the opportunity to progress to Principal / Associate position.

Due to an increased workload, this engineering consultancy is looking to appoint someone with proven experience to become an integral, valued member of their team. This role will see you working on a range of public, commercial and industrial developments.

As a Senior Civil Design Engineer, you will be an integral member of the team where you will:
• Be responsible for managing projects from design to completion
• Work closely with Engineers and other members of staff which will ensure that the projects are delivered to the highest quality, on time and within budget, in a 3D collaborative environment
• Train, mentor and develop junior Engineers
• Be involved in the preparation of drawings including cut and fill appraisals, road design, drainage including SUDS and site levelling

What do you need to apply?
• Degree qualified in Civil Engineering ( or equivalent ) - ideally working towards MICE
• Good working knowledge of Microdrainage, Civils 3D, CAD/BIM
• Excellent understanding of the SUDS Manual, Sewers for Scotland 3 as well as British Standards and Eurocodes
• Extensive experience in development infrastructure
• Ability to work under pressure, to strict deadlines
• Have a strong commercial awareness
• Strong communications skills due to the level of interaction associated with the role
• Depth of knowledge of industry developments as they happen

To apply for this position, please submit your CV to Savanna Mitchell. item.title: Assistant Quantity Surveyor
item.description:
We are pleased to be working along-side one of the UK's leading award-winning property developers who are looking to appoint an Assistant Quantity Surveyor with a genuine desire to enhance their own career and be part of the finalisation of an iconic and historic building.

With 50 years' experience, this company have become specialists in the restoration of some of the UK's most recognisable buildings.

The ideal candidate will have some existing experience in quantity surveying, whether this has been gained as a graduate with work placement experience, or in employment actively working in an Assistant Quantity Surveyor / Quantity Surveyor capacity.

In this role you will be working with and reporting to the onsite Senior Quantity Surveyor to assist in bringing one of our clients most recognisable projects to its completion. This particular project has 18 months until handover.

Key Responsibilities:
• Collating cost reports
• Processing payment applications
• Monitoring project expenditure
• Document/system management
• Provide ad hoc admin support to the wider team as required

If this sounds like the role for you and you are interested in applying, please do so via our website, or contact Jade Mitchell on 01786 446651.

item.description:

With further growth plans in the East of Scotland and a need to bring the right people into their team, they're searching for an Assistant Site Manager / Assistant Site Agent who can be part of the wider progress and take on the challenge of a fast-paced environment.

item.description:
